unnormalised: Labour Court in Patna has ordered reinstatement of Mr. Rajesh Kumar, a former govt. clerk, after he was unfairly dismissed way back in '08. The case dragged on longer than a Bollywood saga, taking a whopping 15 yrs to reach a verdict! Adv. Mishra, representing Mr. Kumar, argued that the dismissal violated Sections 11A and 11B of the Industrial Disputes Act.
normalised: Labour Court in Patna has ordered reinstatement of Mister Rajesh Kumar, a former government clerk, after he was unfairly dismissed way back in two thousand and eight. The case dragged on longer than a Bollywood saga, taking a whopping fifteen years to reach a verdict! Advocate Mishra, representing Mister Kumar, argued that the dismissal violated Sections eleven A and eleven B of the Industrial Disputes Act.

unnormalised: Apparently, Mr. Kumar was caught napping on the job (allegedly!), and his employers thought it was grounds for immediate termination. Imagine, getting fired for a power nap – in India, where we invented siestas! The court, however, found the punishment disproportionate to the 'crime', noting Mr. Kumar's 20+ years of loyal (and presumably mostly awake) service.
